question.title: How can I add a new FieldVector to an existing VectorSchemaRoot
question.body:
In Java Apache Arrow, I have an existing VectorSchemaRoot that's created following this documentation:

BitVector bitVector = new BitVector("boolean", allocator);
bitVector.allocateNew();
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
  bitVector.setSafe(i, i % 2 == 0 ? 0 : 1);
}
bitVector.setValueCount(10);

List<Field> fields = Arrays.asList(bitVector.getField());
List<FieldVector> vectors = Arrays.asList(bitVector);
VectorSchemaRoot vectorSchemaRoot = new VectorSchemaRoot(fields, vectors);

Let's say sometime in the future I need to add an additional FieldVector to the VectorSchemaRoot, how do I go about doing this? I tried using the addVector method but that throws an error when trying to add a new vector.

VarCharVector varCharVector = new VarCharVector("varchar", allocator);
varCharVector.allocateNew();
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
  varCharVector.setSafe(i, ("test" + i).getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
}
varCharVector.setValueCount(10);
vectorSchemaRoot.addVector(1, varCharVector)

question_comments.body: Looks like there may be some quirks with the addVector method - github.com/apache/arrow-java/issues/301
